Description: Lower bowl and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery heavy chalice; interior of bowl slipped and glazed black (only traces remaining); white slip on exterior of foot, glazed but worn; reserved underside; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggests that it belongs to a heavy chalice. Theses types of vessels are found in the Mature Animal Style and Grand Style. The number 380 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 755, pl. XXI, no. 755)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 682, no. 406)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1351) (phase 2)
